Apple___Apple_scab.Symptoms: Olive-green to black spots on leaves, fruit, and twigs; premature leaf drop.
Apple___Apple_scab.Causes: Fungal infection caused by *Venturia inaequalis*, spreads through rain and wind.
Apple___Apple_scab.Natural Treatment: Improve air circulation by pruning, remove fallen leaves, and apply organic sprays like neem oil or compost tea.
Apple___Apple_scab.Recommendation: Apply fungicides like Captan or Mancozeb. Remove infected leaves and ensure good air circulation.

Apple___Black_rot.Symptoms: Dark brown lesions on fruit, leaf spots, and cankers on branches.
Apple___Black_rot.Causes: Fungus *Botryosphaeria obtusa* spread via wind, rain, and infected plant debris.
Apple___Black_rot.Natural Treatment: Remove infected branches and fruit, apply sulfur-based sprays, and improve orchard sanitation.
Apple___Black_rot.Recommendation: Prune infected branches, remove mummified fruit, and use copper-based fungicides.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.Symptoms: Orange or rust-colored spots on leaves, deformed fruit.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.Causes: Fungus *Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae*, spreads from juniper trees.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.Natural Treatment: Remove nearby juniper trees, apply organic sulfur-based fungicides.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.Recommendation: Use Myclobutanil fungicide and remove alternate host plants.

Apple___healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves, fruit, and branches with no visible disease signs.
Apple___healthy.Causes: Proper care, nutrition, and disease prevention.
Apple___healthy.Natural Treatment: Maintain proper irrigation, pruning, and organic fertilization.
Apple___healthy.Recommendation: Continue good cultural practices, pruning, and balanced fertilization.

Blueberry___healthy.Symptoms: No visible diseases, healthy green foliage and fruit.
Blueberry___healthy.Causes: Optimal soil pH, watering, and pest control.
Blueberry___healthy.Natural Treatment: Regular soil testing, organic compost, and mulching.
Blueberry___healthy.Recommendation: Ensure proper watering, soil pH balance, and fertilization.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.Symptoms: White powdery coating on leaves, buds, and fruit.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.Causes: Fungus *Podosphaera clandestina*, thrives in warm, humid conditions.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.Natural Treatment: Apply neem oil or baking soda spray, prune for better air circulation.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.Recommendation: Use sulfur-based fungicides and remove infected plant parts.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.Symptoms: Healthy leaves and fruit with no fungal or bacterial infection.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.Causes: Proper plant care, pruning, and fertilization.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.Natural Treatment: Monitor for pests, use organic compost and balanced fertilizers.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.Recommendation: Maintain regular watering, pruning, and disease monitoring.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.Symptoms: Grayish lesions on leaves that expand into streaks.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.Natural Treatment: Crop rotation, avoid overhead watering, and use compost tea.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.Recommendation: Use resistant varieties, rotate crops, and apply appropriate fungicides.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.Natural Treatment: Improve plant spacing, remove infected leaves, and use organic copper-based sprays.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.Recommendation: Use resistant varieties and apply azoxystrobin fungicide.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.Symptoms: Tan-colored lesions on leaves with a cigar-like shape.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.Natural Treatment: Use resistant hybrids, improve air circulation, and apply potassium bicarbonate spray.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.Recommendation: Apply fungicides at early infection stages and rotate crops.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.Symptoms: Healthy green leaves with no signs of fungal or bacterial infection.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.Causes: Proper nutrition, disease prevention, and irrigation.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.Natural Treatment: Use organic fertilizers and maintain adequate plant spacing.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.Recommendation: Monitor crop health, ensure proper fertilization and pest control.

Grape___Black_rot.Symptoms: Dark brown spots on leaves, fruit shriveling, and cankers.
Grape___Black_rot.Natural Treatment: Prune vines properly, remove infected parts, and apply organic copper sprays.
Grape___Black_rot.Recommendation: Use fungicides like Captan or Mancozeb to control infection.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Symptoms: Dark streaks inside the wood, leaf yellowing, and fruit shriveling.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Causes: Fungal disease complex including *Phaeoacremonium* and *Phaeomoniella* species.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Natural Treatment: Use balanced organic fertilizers, prune infected parts, and ensure proper irrigation.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).Recommendation: Apply fungicides and avoid wounding the vines.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.Symptoms: Brown irregular spots on leaves, eventually causing leaf drop.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.Natural Treatment: Improve air circulation, use compost-based sprays, and remove infected leaves.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.Recommendation: Use Bordeaux mixture or copper fungicides.

Grape___healthy.Symptoms: Vibrant green leaves, healthy fruit clusters, no visible diseases.
Grape___healthy.Causes: Proper vineyard management, irrigation, and disease prevention.
Grape___healthy.Natural Treatment: Use organic compost and balanced pruning techniques.
Grape___healthy.Recommendation: Continue good vineyard practices and proper irrigation.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).Symptoms: Yellowing leaves, misshapen fruit, bitter taste, stunted growth.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).Causes: Caused by *Candidatus Liberibacter* bacteria, spread by psyllid insects.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).Natural Treatment: Use natural predators like parasitic wasps to control psyllids, apply neem oil sprays.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).Recommendation: No cure exists; remove infected trees and control psyllid populations with insecticides.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.Symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves and fruit, premature leaf drop, sunken lesions on fruit.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.Causes: Caused by *Xanthomonas arboricola* bacteria, spreads in humid conditions.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.Natural Treatment: Use copper-based organic sprays, prune infected leaves, improve air circulation.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.Recommendation: Apply copper-based bactericides, avoid overhead watering, and use resistant varieties.

Peach___healthy.Symptoms: Lush green leaves, healthy fruit development, strong branches.
Peach___healthy.Causes: Proper watering, fertilization, and pest control.
Peach___healthy.Natural Treatment: Use compost and organic mulch to enhance soil health.
Peach___healthy.Recommendation: Ensure proper irrigation, fertilization, and regular monitoring for pests.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.Symptoms: Water-soaked lesions on leaves, dark spots on fruit, defoliation.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.Causes: Caused by *Xanthomonas campestris* bacteria, thrives in warm, wet conditions.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.Natural Treatment: Apply copper-based organic sprays, remove infected plants, use resistant varieties.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.Recommendation: Use disease-free seeds, apply copper sprays, and avoid overhead watering.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.Symptoms: Deep green leaves, firm fruit, no disease symptoms.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.Causes: Proper nutrition, pest control, and well-drained soil.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.Natural Treatment: Use compost and natural fertilizers like fish emulsion.
Pepper,_bell___healthy.Recommendation: Maintain healthy soil, monitor for pests, and ensure adequate watering.

Potato___Early_blight.Symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on leaves, yellowing foliage.
Potato___Early_blight.Causes: Caused by *Alternaria solani* fungus, spreads through soil and plant debris.
Potato___Early_blight.Natural Treatment: Rotate crops, remove infected plant debris, apply neem oil.
Potato___Early_blight.Recommendation: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil, use resistant varieties, and practice crop rotation.

Potato___Late_blight.Symptoms: Dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves, white fungal growth, rapid plant decay.
Potato___Late_blight.Causes: Caused by *Phytophthora infestans* pathogen, spreads in cool, humid conditions.
Potato___Late_blight.Natural Treatment: Remove infected plants, apply copper fungicides, ensure good air circulation.
Potato___Late_blight.Recommendation: Use fungicides like metalaxyl, practice crop rotation, and remove infected plants immediately.

Potato___healthy.Symptoms: Green, upright plants, no visible spots or lesions on leaves.
Potato___healthy.Causes: Proper soil health management and pest control.
Potato___healthy.Natural Treatment: Use organic compost and proper irrigation techniques.
Potato___healthy.Recommendation: Ensure balanced fertilization, practice proper crop rotation, and monitor plant health.

Raspberry___healthy.Symptoms: Healthy green leaves, abundant fruit production, no signs of disease.
Raspberry___healthy.Causes: Optimal soil conditions, proper watering, and pest control.
Raspberry___healthy.Natural Treatment: Apply mulch to retain moisture and prevent weed growth.
Raspberry___healthy.Recommendation: Ensure good air circulation, maintain disease-free planting materials, and use organic mulch.

Soybean___healthy.Symptoms: Dark green leaves, strong plant structure, no visible signs of disease.
Soybean___healthy.Causes: Proper soil fertility and pest control.
Soybean___healthy.Natural Treatment: Use crop rotation and natural pest deterrents like marigolds.
Soybean___healthy.Recommendation: Monitor for pests and diseases, maintain soil health, and ensure proper irrigation.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.Symptoms: White powdery patches on leaves, stunted plant growth, yellowing foliage.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.Causes: Caused by *Podosphaera xanthii* fungus, thrives in dry and humid conditions.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.Natural Treatment: Apply sulfur or potassium bicarbonate-based fungicides, use milk spray as a natural remedy.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.Recommendation: Increase air circulation, apply sulfur-based fungicides, and avoid overhead watering.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.Symptoms: Purple to brown spots on leaves, dried leaf edges, reduced fruit yield.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.Causes: Caused by *Diplocarpon earlianum* fungus, spreads in humid conditions.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.Natural Treatment: Remove infected leaves, apply neem oil, improve air circulation.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.Recommendation: Apply fungicides like captan, ensure proper spacing between plants, and remove infected foliage.

Strawberry___healthy.Symptoms: Bright green foliage, plump fruit, no signs of disease.
Strawberry___healthy.Causes: Proper care, balanced fertilization, and pest control.
Strawberry___healthy.Natural Treatment: Use straw mulch to prevent soil splashing and disease spread.
Strawberry___healthy.Recommendation: Maintain good soil drainage, ensure proper irrigation, and monitor plant health regularly.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.Symptoms: Small dark spots on leaves and fruit, water-soaked lesions.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.Causes: Caused by *Xanthomonas* bacteria, spreads in warm, wet conditions.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.Natural Treatment: Apply copper-based sprays, remove infected leaves, and use disease-free seeds.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.Recommendation: Rotate crops, avoid overhead watering, and disinfect gardening tools.

Tomato___Early_blight.Symptoms: Brown spots on lower leaves, yellowing foliage, stem lesions.
Tomato___Early_blight.Causes: Caused by *Alternaria solani* fungus, spreads through soil and air.
Tomato___Early_blight.Natural Treatment: Apply compost tea, remove infected leaves, and use mulch.
Tomato___Early_blight.Recommendation: Apply fungicides, practice crop rotation, and ensure good air circulation.

Tomato___Late_blight.Symptoms: Dark, water-soaked spots on leaves, white fungal growth on leaf undersides.
Tomato___Late_blight.Causes: Caused by *Phytophthora infestans*, spreads in humid conditions.
Tomato___Late_blight.Natural Treatment: Use copper sprays, remove infected plants, and apply neem oil.
Tomato___Late_blight.Recommendation: Use resistant varieties, apply fungicides, and space plants properly.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.Symptoms: Yellow spots on upper leaves, velvety olive-green mold underneath.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.Causes: Caused by *Passalora fulva* fungus, spreads in humid areas.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.Natural Treatment: Increase air circulation, apply neem oil, and prune infected leaves.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.Recommendation: Use resistant varieties, apply copper fungicides, and reduce greenhouse humidity.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.Symptoms: Small circular brown spots on lower leaves, yellowing foliage.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.Causes: Caused by *Septoria lycopersici* fungus, spreads in warm, wet conditions.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.Natural Treatment: Apply neem oil, remove infected leaves, and use mulch.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.Recommendation: Apply fungicides, improve air circulation, and practice crop rotation.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.Symptoms: Tiny yellow specks on leaves, webbing under leaves, leaf curling.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.Causes: Caused by *Tetranychus urticae* mites, spreads in dry and warm conditions.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.Natural Treatment: Spray neem oil, introduce ladybugs or predatory mites, and mist plants regularly.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.Recommendation: Increase humidity, avoid over-fertilization, and apply insecticidal soap if needed.

Tomato___Target_Spot.Symptoms: Dark concentric rings on leaves, fruit rot, defoliation.
Tomato___Target_Spot.Causes: Caused by *Corynespora cassiicola* fungus, spreads through infected debris and water splash.
Tomato___Target_Spot.Natural Treatment: Apply copper fungicides, remove affected leaves, and ensure proper ventilation.
Tomato___Target_Spot.Recommendation: Use resistant varieties, apply fungicides early, and avoid overhead watering.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.Symptoms: Upward curling leaves, stunted growth, yellowing leaf edges.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.Causes: Spread by whiteflies, common in hot climates.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.Natural Treatment: Control whiteflies using neem oil or insecticidal soap.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.Recommendation: Use resistant varieties, remove infected plants, and install sticky traps.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.Symptoms: Mottled yellow-green leaves, distorted fruit, stunted plant growth.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.Causes: Caused by *Tomato mosaic virus (ToMV)*, spreads through contaminated tools and hands.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.Natural Treatment: Remove and destroy infected plants, disinfect tools regularly.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.Recommendation: Use virus-resistant varieties, sanitize tools, and avoid tobacco products near plants.

Tomato___healthy.Symptoms: Deep green leaves, strong plant structure, healthy fruit development.
Tomato___healthy.Causes: Balanced nutrition, proper watering, and disease prevention.
Tomato___healthy.Recommendation: Ensure proper nutrition, monitor for pests, and practice good irrigation.
